description: The verbal sense is from the notion of causing mischief like a rat.

verbs.description: ratten (third-person singular simple present rattens, present participle rattening, simple past and past participle rattened)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, Northern England) To sabotage machinery or tools as part of an industrial dispute, particularly the tools of a workman who went against the union.
examples: Did you also employ them to ratten people if they had broken any rules of your society, for instance, by having too many apprentices?
